utterances.utterance: You've been talking now for five minutes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Greg, his idea, his only idea has been build a wall and that he hasn't even done that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK, here's the issue that's the real problem and it's not just with immigration. It's also with homelessness and other problems that we -- that afflict our society. The left adheres to one singular strategy and that is any kind of process, any kind of law, any kind of logic or any kind of reason is a symptom of cruelty. You will be accused of demonizing if you want to help the homeless off the street. You demonize. If you want to enforce your border, you demonize. This only happens though when the other side is in charge, right, when the Republicans are in charge. But once the Democrats are in charge then they start acting like adults. President Obama acted like an adult when he was saying the very same things that President Trump is. Border policy like a lot of things in life requires a process, a system, which entails rules and enforcement. Adults get this. The media and the dems, who you cannot tell the difference -- when you do that montage, you couldn't tell which one was in the media or which was running for president because they are precisely the same animal. And I mean animal purely as a metaphor.

utterances.speaker: SANDRA SMITH, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I feel like I have to raise my voice to make my point here, but I think --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, this is THE FIVE.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Welcome to the party.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I will (inaudible) however, Greg, with actual words of "Obama guys." Remember the president referred to the acting DHS secretary, McAleenan, we had on "America's Newsroom" yesterday morning -- 9:00 to noon by the way, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: With Hemmer, right?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: He said, "This is a significant step at addressing the core aspect of the crisis at the border." Obama's former border patrol chief, Mark Morgan was on this morning said, "This is a game changer. This will absolutely eliminate at least part of the border crisis." But you go back, rewind one year ago when Jeh Johnson, Obama's, Juan, DHS secretary made the point that the Flores is an issue. They ran into this. This was a problem. This is a loophole that has to be closed. But, I also want to address the media talking about this indefinite period of time, that these migrants can be detained. Indefinite period of time, Supreme Court ruling, 2001, 180 days is the longest period of time. So, realistically speaking, they are talking about a 50 to 60-day time period that they need to properly process these migrants, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's the point, isn't it? So then what we have on the table should be how do we properly process and deal with the fact that we have on the books asylum laws, Sandra, and we want it in fact, hold to the law. Greg talks about let's do everything by the books, by the law. The president has no idea. So you have the House and the Senate --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you are for illegal immigration. We should do things by the law.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know what's against the law, crossing the border. All right, another major point of contention on the campaign trail, the Green New Deal. Bernie Sanders giving Trump plenty of new ammo by rolling out his own version that costs $16 trillion. Despite all the massive spending of the socialist, he somehow says it's going to pay for itself. Greg, don't you like when they say it's going to pay for itself?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think $16 trillion is nearly enough. That barely covers the perpetual motion oscillator and the unicorn farts. There is nothing real -- what this is you're seeing is I see you a trillion and I raise you a trillion. He sees what everybody else is doing. And the thing is, you know, Juan said yesterday that the Republicans are viewing Biden the way the Democrats view Trump. I think the Democrats are viewing Bernie the way they view Trump. He's the contender because he is the one who's got the momentum. I would be very -- he's going to be the nominee. I've changed my mind.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What did you say?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Bernie?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: After this new deal, I am convinced he will be the nominee.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, you know what I love about this new deal? He's going to give everybody a grant to get a new car. If you read this, everything is I'm getting rid of fossil fuel-dependent vehicle --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a Yugo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- and all old cars. So, everybody can get a new car.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'd be in favor of it too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like Casper (ph) clunk for two.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute -- wait -- don't you drive that Benz around town?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, I don't

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a Maserati actually.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, I drive my boss. I have that motorcycle with the sidecar I ride around with my dog.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I got it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, is it like when Republican say the tax cuts are going to pay for themselves?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, then what do I have to speak? You just explained. In fact, I think it's Trump who has driven the deficit through the roof and who says, oh, it will pay for itself, don't worry about it America.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But this will pay for itself?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The number one concern is -- well that's what Bernie says. But I think, you know what, this is about the Green New Deal, which is an idea, but Trump attacks it as if it's real, as if its legislation, because he wants to distract from the fact that he has, again, no ideas about how to deal with the environment --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can only attack something if it's legislation?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The idea is nuclear.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAM
utterances.utterance: Well, if it's real, in other words, if I --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, the Green New Deal isn't real?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If I say to you, hey Jesse, what do you think about playing some ball next Tuesday and then you say yes, but if he plays ball, he could get hurt and he's old, I mean, it's ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Do you like it? Do you like what he pitched? Is there --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is there what?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Do you like what he pitched, Bernie Sanders?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, Juan --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. I think it's an idea. I don't think -- in other words, Sandra, it is not as if it's oh, this is exactly what we're going to do. This is about getting a start --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, so you're not allowed to attack ideas. You can only attack legislation according to Juan Williams.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You guys couldn't wait to attack the birthright issue, OK. He had an idea.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Just an idea.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.utterance: Just an idea, not legislation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's not even a good idea.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, but that's your opinion.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAM
utterances.utterance: No, well --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I bet most Americans would agree with that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Remember, he was going to buy Greenland earlier in the week.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We still are. We still are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Up next, if you thought it couldn't get any worse, wait until you hear the latest media smears against President Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Once the face of hard news, CNN is now the butt of America's jokes. The latest oddity, Chris Cuomo conspires over President Trump's appearance. Yes, he looks exactly the same since he became president and that can't be good.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS CUOMO, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: Look at presidents when they come in and when they leave. I mean, come on. Look at Clinton's hair, right. George W. Bush looks like he got a beat down. Obama looks like his own grandfather. I mean, look at it. I mean, this is a very hard job because of the stress that they carry with them. Now let's look at this president. It's been almost three years since Trump won the presidency. He looks exactly the same. His hair is like, you know, I don't know what's going on with that but look, he may do things that presidents in the past haven't done to augment their physical reality. But it could also be that he doesn't care the way others have.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Only on the clown news network can an anchor wonder if the president is augmenting his physical reality. In other words, what the hell does this mean? But I guess since they've run out of ways to say Trump is crazy, they moved on to -- he somehow has magically stopped the aging process. I don't know about you, but maybe I'd leave the paranormal analysis to experts in crop circles. Meanwhile, you got to wonder how much CNN pays for this political analysis.

utterances.speaker: BRIANNA KEILAR, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: I am the chosen one he says, after the president re-tweeted a conspiracy theorist radio host who said that he is like the second coming. So, what do you make of all this?

utterances.speaker: GLORIA BORGER, CNN POLITICAL ANALYST
utterances.utterance: I think maybe his mommy should've told him she loved him a little bit more. I don't know. You know, it's hard -- it's just -- it's hard to know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hard to know. Someone has a future in online psychology. So Gloria, you did Trump just now. Tell us why Chris Cuomo is so angry. But talk about never aging, she looks great. The only thing that gets old is her shtick. But only CNN could frame not aging as a bad thing. Imagine Trump was showing his age. Cuomo-tose would say the job was wearing him down so much he is now a serious threat to survival of our republic. Sorry, no such luck. Trump looks the same as he did when he took office. Too bad you can't say the same for CNN.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Cuomo-tose.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cuomo-tose, you like that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a good one, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK, then I'll keep it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right. You know, Greg, if you were married to Melania --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You'll probably have that youthful look too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are you saying something about my wife?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just saying. You look great.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You look marvelous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe it's the peace and prosperity glow because there's no wars, there is no recession, its not aging him that bad. Also, you don't really see the difference. You got to put Trump 2016 and Trump 2024, then maybe you could do a side by side.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Only when he runs, that's when you take -- is the beginning of his third term.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly, maybe 2028. And also, you know when Trump wakes up in the morning, you hear he doesn't even remember what happened the rest -- the next day or the day before because he doesn't let anxiety and negativity weigh him down the way -- an all-pro NFL quarterback, that's how they scout these guys. You want a guy that gets burned for a 50-yard pass. Next snap, he is still up there with swagger, forgot about the last play and is still talking trash and that is Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, unlike Gloria, you should get an award for analysis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because in fact, Trump gets burned on every play. It doesn't seem to matter. And then when he gets embarrassed and the media reports on it, you guys say, the media is terrible. Why are they saying that he was talked about Greenland and then said, why would anybody call that absurd, buying Greenland.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Truman --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Truman had it first, a Democrat I believe.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait, wait, wait --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- and then he says, you know what, there's no recession. The economy is great. We're thinking about tax cuts and Jerome Powell, why don't you cut rates? But the economy is great. It does great.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You know what the amazing part of this is,they would rather have the president act like Mueller who doesn't remember or know anything about what he was working on for the last two years or Joe Biden who doesn't of the difference between truth and fact. I mean, that's what they want. They want if someone is a certain age, they should just be stupid. Here's the bottom line. With the 800 points, everybody went nuts. We're going into recession, that's it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And you and I both know that it's the animal instincts that decide how we go forward in the economy -- 800 points, we came back immediately. All right. So, everything is fine in terms of the economy, in terms of our being safe. I mean they just want him to be crazy and he's not because he's used to distress. He's not a politician. He didn't come up the easy way the way the rest of them did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAM
utterances.utterance: No, no.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, he weren't tired. He worked the --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I think we're also leaving out one fact that he points out often, is he doesn't drink, he doesn't smoke or have any of these vices.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Imagine how good you'd look.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. But that's -- I think that's the point because --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Fair point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, because like people who -- everybody I know who doesn't drink has too much energy for me, right?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: And that's a lie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did you say for you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's like my friends who don't drink are -- they are overpowering with energy.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I guess his problem he doesn't sleep either. He's tweeting at 3:00 a.m.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He's not sleeping.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's working for us, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Even you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He won't sleep on the job.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He doesn't need to do it, that's the big point.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He doesn't need to do what?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Fair to attack someone's look?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He doesn't need to be president. He could be playing golf in a million places.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I agree he doesn't need to be president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sandra, you raised a good point.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you think if he were a woman, like I kind of did with Gloria just to test the seat?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I just don't even know how this is relevant to the performance that he's doing and amount of work that he's doing in the White House. But I will say, the thought has crossed my mind, it has. He has not, I mean, we go back to the Bush's and Obama years, and the presidents do age. They change over time. However, just for fun for the segment, I went back and looked at safer example, that Oprah interview in 1988. He hasn't changed much at all. I mean, his physical appearance is still the same.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What was the doctor's note? He said he was the healthiest man on Earth? OK, so doctor's orders. I mean, I think you got to listen to medical professionals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is also a correlation, I mean, it's not -- there's a decade where you tend to age and a decade like --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: When is that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Obama --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, Obama, that's when you go gray, was at the same time he was president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, it wasn't like it was the presidency. It's just that at the - - in that decade.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Gregory, I have an idea.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, really? Is that what you think it is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Gregory, I have an idea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Remember when there was that conspiracy theory about the wife that it was in fact not Melania but a body double?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think Madame Tussauds has provided a body double for Trump. Yes.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Oh my, you heard it here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what though, I will say, Cuomo is right about the observation though. He is right.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I think it's fair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What was his name? Cuomo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Cuomo-tose.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Cuomo-tose.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. All right. Don't get mad at me, Chris.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Don't call him by his nickname.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's going to beat you (inaudible) down the stairs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I've seen his biceps.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You could sleep on them. OK, the liberal mob out in full force attacking Sean Spicer for joining "Dancing with the Stars" when we come back.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Got your dancing shoe, Greg. Sean Spicer joining "Dancing with the Stars" creating a lot of controversy. Host Tom Bergeron slamming what he is calling "politically divisive bookings," while Twitter users are calling for a boycott of the show, and some media outlets attacking the former White House press secretary. Check out some of these headlines. The "New York Times" saying "Don't Let Sean Spicer Tap Dance Out of Infamy on "Dancing with the Stars." And NBC News calling Spicer's casting "a slap in the face to every American he lied to." Spicer reacting on "Fox & Friends" earlier this morning.

utterances.speaker: SEAN SPICER, FORMER WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECREARY
utterances.utterance: This should be two hours of politics free, but more than that, and I hope what this show is at the end of the season, is an example of people of a bunch of different backgrounds getting together, leaving politics aside, and having a good time in a civil and respectful way. And so my hope and goal is that at the end of the season, Tom looks back and says, you know what, we need more of this, not less of it.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: All right. So he says he's not going to care what the heck they think about his performance. I would be pretty nervous going into this. Jesse, would you do "Dancing with the Stars"?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Would I? Well, it depends on how my career is going. I might need the money, and it's a lot of money. It's a 150 Gs ust to walk in and every round you advance you get 10 to 25. It's first class. You get new wardrobe and you just, you know, you're around with a beautiful woman all day and you're dipping her and you're waltzing here and you're spinning her. I mean, things could be worse for Sean Spicer.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Stop it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he gets to hang out with who, Christie Brinkley, James Van Der Beek?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No! Not the Van Der Beek.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "Dawson's Creek." Not the Beek, yes! Ray Lewis -- wait, didn't Ray Lewis knifed someone, but they're upset about Sean Spicer?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And "The Bachelorette." So, it's an action-packed cast and it's a no-brainer, but I don't think he can dance. He's from Rhode Island.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: Actually, he took to the dance floor or this studio floor this morning on "Fox & Friends" with Ainsley and he was showing his moves.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's see it.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: I mean, Ainsley's definitely got the moves.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And she's got it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no. Oh, no. It was bad. That was bad. It was really bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is drunk lady at a wedding dance.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: You know what, you got to -- judge, you got to hand it to him. I mean, he's going to try to avoid --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Boy, they're going to hand it to him. I don't know how long he is going to last, that's number one. But number two is, you know what, they are so, look, think about what you just read. NBC, "The New York Times," people want to boycott Dancing with the -- I mean, how small can you get? You know what I would do if I were Sean? I would show up in a MAGA hat. I would wear a MAGA shirt. That will have great --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: You never know. They might.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I mean, they're so small, it's ridiculous. It might be fun, you never know, but I don't think -- look, they'd rather have, what's it, Ray Lewis? Wasn't he charged with murder? And then they had another, Tonya Harding, and then they had that Ryan Loetche who was suspended. I mean, all these people, nobody cares about them. You could do drugs or who is --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: The only one that Bergeron seems to, the host, seems to take issue with is Sean Spicer.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I understand what Tom is saying because the show is supposed to be escape. It is supposed to be fun. You turn it on and you're supposed to like just enjoy the evening. I mean, it's just like people complain on the right about the NFL. Why are the players protesting? Why is he bringing politics into fun? I understand that argument but, I mean, to me it obviously, I think protests of civil rights is a bigger issue than bringing a guy into a politically divided moment in America onto "Dancing with the Stars." But I will say this. I think that Sean should -- if they made the decision -- Sean didn't make the decision to hire himself. They made the decision to hire Sean. So we should stop picking on Sean and I say that well aware that my son worked for Sean for many years at the Republican National Committee. So, I'm not saying it because of any connection like that. I just think it's not fair to Sean because he didn't decide to hire himself.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. First of all, how brave was Tom Bergeron just to save face with the few friends he has in Bel Air. He has to virtue signal a tweet that it's not my fault. What a wimp. Just so people wouldn't stare at him in line at Trader Joe's as he picks up his kale. Little serious point here. How lucky are you to have the time and energy to be outraged over this, right? Clearly, you do not have a sick family member, right. You don't have any financial problems. You don't have a health issue yourself. If you are outraged over this essentially you have a void in your life that needs filling. And I will even say it might be spiritual moral. It must be something, because if you actually - if this bothers you, you really seriously need to get a life. So, the only piece of advice I ever give is every morning, if you're upset about this, every morning gets up, go to the bathroom mirror and say am I today going to be a plus or a minus. OK. That will keep you from getting outraged over this crap. It's not a life mission, but in a week, it will become one and you'll stop being a jackass.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The problem is Bergeron came out and said, well they're going to put him in charge of what is assessing audience size. He is going to continue.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He is going to be the butt of all the jokes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, but that's not fair to Sean.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
